meanings.definition: Covered in small, raised bumps or knots.
meanings.sent1: The knubby blanket felt rough against my skin.
meanings.sent2: Her knubby sweater was warm and cozy.
meanings.sent3: The knubby surface of the rug tickled my toes.
meanings.sent4: The knubby texture of the tree bark resembled tiny mountains.
meanings.sent5: I could easily identify the knubby fabric blindfolded.

meanings.definition: Having a rough or uneven texture.
meanings.sent1: The knubby surface of the rock scratched my hand.
meanings.sent2: The knubby paper was difficult to write on.
meanings.sent3: His knubby hands felt like sandpaper.
meanings.sent4: The knubby road made the bike ride bumpy.
meanings.sent5: The knubby texture of the wall reminded me of sandpaper.

meanings.definition: A fabric or material with a bumpy surface.
meanings.sent1: She loved the feel of the knubby on her fingertips.
meanings.sent2: The knubby of the carpet made it perfect for bare feet.
meanings.sent3: The knubby on the couch made it look like a cozy cloud.
meanings.sent4: The knubby of the towel provided extra grip.
meanings.sent5: The knubby of the fabric caught the light in a unique way.
